Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
About V2X-Sim
V2X-Sim, short for vehicle-to-everything simulation, is the first synthetic V2X-aided collaborative perception dataset in autonomous driving developed by AI4CE Lab at NYU and MediaBrain Group at SJTU to stimulate multi-agent multi-modality multi-task perception research. Due to the immaturity of V2X and the cost of simultaneously operating multiple autonomous vehicles, it is very expensive and laborious to build such a real-world dataset for research communities. Therefore, we use highly realistic CARLA-SUMO co-simulation to ensure the representativeness of our dataset compared to real-world driving scenarios.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: Includes high-resolution RGB images, LiDAR point clouds, semantic segmentation, 3D bounding boxes, depth maps, GPS coordinates, and IMU data.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: The data is first uploaded to a local node where a unique Content Identifier (CID) is generated. A storage deal is then initiated. During this process, the data is divided into smaller pieces, encoded, and replicated before being sealed into storage sectors. Miners carry out a series of operations—including pre-commit, sealing, and commit—to securely store the data. They also regularly provide proof-of-storage to verify the data's continued integrity. When retrieval is requested, users can access the decoded data from the miners using the CID.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Greater China, Asia other than Greater China, Europe, North America
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: Venus built-in data transfer, IPFS, HTTP or FTP server
